author: vors
body:
Follow-up from #1005 

PR #1091 enabled xUnit test run, but it one test was failing and I temporarily disabled it.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @vors I think you fixed this. Re-enable test?

comments.author: vors
comments.body: I'm looking at it right now, but have some problem with running on Linux. If you can take care of re-enabling it, it would be fantastic.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Heh, funny story about xUnit tests... I'm having to disable them with the ALC changes.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @JamesWTruher I don't particularly want to waste time attempting to fix the xUnit test runner if yours is coming any time soon. Any chance of that happening?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @vors I'm moving this assignment back to you, noting that it's still blocked until we have a working xUnit runner or a different assembly loading solution.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: @chunqingchen do you want to take it over, since you are working on xunit runner?

comments.author: chunqingchen
comments.body: I am closing this issue as we are not running many tests through xunit runner. we are still focusing on lite tests.

title: Investigate TestRunspaceWithPowerShellAndInitialSessionState xUnit failure
